attrs.label: Certificate ID
attrs.description:
The certificate to use for Vaultwarden </br>
Using the Rocket method for TLS setup is NOT recommended </br>
Prefer a reverse proxy with a valid certificate

attrs.label: Domain

The domain to use for Vaultwarden </br>
Format is: https://sub.domain.tld:port

attrs.label: Automatic Permissions
attrs.description:
Automatically set permissions for the host path.
Enabling this, will check the top level directory,</br>
If it finds incorrect permissions, it will `chown` the
host path to the user and group required for the
postgres container.

attrs.label: Additional Storage
attrs.description: Additional storage for Vaultwarden.

attrs.label: Type
attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.</br>
SMB Share: Is a SMB share that is mounted to as a volume.

ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)

1.1.12.readme:
Vaultwarden

Vaultwarden Alternative implementation of the Bitwarden server API written in Rust and compatible with upstream Bitwarden clients

While the option to use Rocket for TLS is there, it is not recommended. Instead, use a reverse proxy to handle TLS termination.

Using HTTPS is required for the most of the features to work (correctly).
